meanings.definition: The quality or state of being like a swain.
meanings.sent1: Her swainishness shone through as she tended to the animals on the farm.
meanings.sent2: The young man's swainishness was evident in his gentle and caring nature.
meanings.sent3: His swainishness made him the perfect candidate for the role of Romeo in the school play.
meanings.sent4: The swainishness of the knight in shining armor captured the hearts of all who saw him.
meanings.sent5: The swainishness of the prince charmed even the most skeptical of courtiers.

meanings.definition: The behavior or characteristics of a swain.
meanings.sent1: The swainishness of the boy next door was always evident in his chivalrous actions.
meanings.sent2: She admired his swainishness, especially when he held the door open for her.
meanings.sent3: His swainishness sometimes led him to attempt grand romantic gestures that often backfired.
meanings.sent4: The swainishness of the gentleman was unmatched in the eyes of the village.
meanings.sent5: Her swainishness was so endearing that it melted even the coldest of hearts.

meanings.definition: The appearance or mannerisms of a swain.
meanings.sent1: In his swainishness, he wore a straw hat and carried a bouquet of wildflowers.
meanings.sent2: The actor's swainishness on stage captivated the audience with his charm.
meanings.sent3: Her swainishness was so convincing that she was mistaken for a character in a period drama.
meanings.sent4: The swainishness of the young man made him stand out in a crowd of city dwellers.
meanings.sent5: The swainishness of the suitor won over the heart of the fair maiden.
